ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: R lists, especially nested lists, can be very difficult to visualize or represent. Sometimes 'str()' is not enough, so this suite of htmlwidgets is designed to help see, understand, and maybe even modify your R lists.  The function 'reactjson()' requires a package 'reactR' that can be installed from CRAN or <https://github.com/timelyportfolio/reactR>.

R lists, especially nested lists, can be very difficult to visualize or represent. Sometimes 'str()' is not enough, so this suite of htmlwidgets is designed to help see, understand, and maybe even modify your R lists.  The function 'reactjson()' requires a package 'reactR' that can be installed from CRAN or <https://github.com/timelyportfolio/reactR>.

name: r-listviewer
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "4.0.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-listviewer
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/listviewer_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/listviewer/listviewer_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7eb128afa345c7cd68652aa76e70bb6057400abca0d041c9b899cc5605bace41

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-htmltools
    - r-htmlwidgets
    - r-shiny
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-htmltools
    - r-htmlwidgets
    - r-shiny

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('listviewer')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('listviewer')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/timelyportfolio/listviewer
  license: MIT
  summary: R lists, especially nested lists, can be very difficult to visualize or represent. Sometimes 'str()' is not enough, so this suite of htmlwidgets is designed to help see, understand, and maybe even modify your R lists.  The function 'reactjson()' requires a package 'reactR' that can be installed from CRAN or <https://github.com/timelyportfolio/reactR>.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
